body_html:
The nasm assembler that bazel is building is part of the host toolchain, not a regular build target.

I doubt you really want to do this, but if you really want to set a -D on host tools, you can use --host_copt:
https://docs.bazel.build/versions/master/bazel-user-manual.html#flag--host_copt
body_text:
The nasm assembler that bazel is building is part of the host toolchain, not a regular build target.
I doubt you really want to do this, but if you really want to set a -D on host tools, you can use --host_copt:
https://docs.bazel.build/versions/master/bazel-user-manual.html#flag--host_copt
body:
The `nasm` assembler that `bazel` is building is part of the host toolchain, not a regular build target.

I doubt you really want to do this, but if you really want to set a -D on host tools, you can use `--host_copt`:
https://docs.bazel.build/versions/master/bazel-user-manual.html#flag--host_copt
